abstracts.cdata!:
The ratings for the project were as
            follows: the outcome was unsatisfactory, the sustainability
            was unlikely, the institutional development impact was
            modest, and the Bank and borrower performance were both
            unsatisfactory. The lessons learned indicate that health
            sector reform and the supporting donor interventions need to
            be driven by results, a clear set of objectives, and
            performance benchmarks for service delivery institutions.
            The focus of health sector reform needs to be on removing
            systemic bottlenecks. Expanding coverage needs to be
            carefully prioritized and driven by demand as well as
            long-term resource availability. In order to create a spirit
            of professionalism and motivation among health care staff,
            developing an appropriate incentive system to attract,
            maintain, and further qualify staff is crucially important.
            While the principle of contributions is very important, it
            should not constitute a financial barrier to accessibility.
            Donors need to significantly co-finance recurrent costs of
            Niger's health system so that the country has at least
            a chance to come close to reaching the Millennium
            Development Goals (MDGs). The Bank with the planned new
            health sector operation plays a crucial role in this
            context. In pursuing an approach based on Sector-wide
            Approach (SWAp) principles, the Bank (i) would foster donor
            alignment around the country's health sector priorities
            with common objectives, and indicators linked to a
            medium-term expenditure framework; and (ii) would strengthen
            Ministry of Health (MOH) capacity in becoming a full actor
            in the Poverty Reduction Support Credit (PRSC) process. Bank
            support would need to be delivered in an integrated manner,
            fully aligning it with other country operations, and would
            need to have a long-term perspective.
